repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Third Poverty Reduction Support
            Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Third Poverty
            Reduction Support Credit Project in Albania was
            satisfactory, with a likely sustainability, substantial
            institutional development impact, and satisfactory
            performances by both the Bank and Borrower.  Lessons learned
            include: the broad-based operation did allow flexibility to
            seize opportunities where both development impact and
            likelihood of implementation were high; it is recommended
            that future policy-based loans take a more focused view,
            pursuing a core theme in each leg of the overall operation,
            even while maintaining an integrated approach to the larger
            agenda, given the long-term nature of most reforms; at the
            end of the day, lack of ownership cannot be substituted by
            more conditionality; monitoring indicators need to be given
            as much care as the conditions themselves; the National
            Strategy for Social and Economic Development's close
            link with the World Bank reduced donor buy-in in some cases;
            donor coordination pays strong dividends when successful;
            complementarity with investment operations should continue
            to be pursued; future lending should try to ensure that
            policy-based operations receive a significant share of
            overall lending, and are strategically tied to the
            investment lending agenda; much of the agenda is long-term,
            and needs persistence, and sustainability cannot be defined
            independently of development community support; analytical
            work should continue through the program; the contrast
            between health and education speaks to the importance of
            seeing the big picture at the outset of the program, and is
            echoed in the business environment; the partnership between
            the Bank and the IMF has been a fruitful one.

5528951.majtheme: Public sector governance,Human development,Social protection and risk management

repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Third Poverty Reduction Support
            Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Poverty Reduction Support
            Credit supports the National Strategy for Social and
            Economic Development (NSSED), in line with the Bank's
            strategy presented in the Country Assistance Strategy (CAS).
            The project supports the implementation of key reforms aimed
            at promoting economic growth, strengthening public sector
            governance, and improving social service delivery.
            Furthermore, the project will help consolidate reforms in
            public administration, public expenditure management and
            accountability, and social sector service delivery,
            supporting the country's efforts to increase the
            Government's accountability, responsiveness, and
            effectiveness. Civil service administration reforms would
            help increase professionalism among civil servants, and,
            together with reforms aimed at improving the performance of
            social sector line agencies, and the social insurance
            institute, would thus improve the public sector's
            capacity to effectively regulate, monitor, and deliver
            services. Reforms in the areas of public expenditure
            management, financial accountability, and procurement,
            improve transparency and the effectiveness of public
            spending. There is however, the risk that the institutional
            mechanisms and frameworks put in place to improve
            transparency, and accountability in the public sector, may
            at times be circumvented to reap political benefits in the
            run- up to the mid-2005 elections. Nonetheless, the
            Government's track record in maintaining macroeconomic
            stability through prudent fiscal, and monetary policies,
            constitutes a strong mitigating factor. In addition, the
            support provided under this project will be followed by
            balance of payments support from the European Community. On
            a longer term basis, the Government is committed to
            increasing budgetary revenues, through improvements in tax
            administration, and revenue collection, to help strengthen
            its fiscal position, and external balance.
